channel.title: Kidnapping in Colorado
channel.description:
http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-body-jessica-ridgeway-20121012,0,4127604.story
The place the body was found (no announcement if it is Jessica yet) is down the street from my school :| I actually drove past the site where they found the remains today, and it was a bit spooky. Especially with having younger family members who attend school near where this all happened. With the fires we've had recently, the Aurora shooting, and now this there has been a huge emotional toll on everyone. Has anyone else seen or heard about this on the news? I'm not sure wide spread this story is with the media.

item.title: Kidnapping in Colorado
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

I might have expressed myself in a incorrect way. I’m still an European. I might also have misread you post, if you think someone you know might be the victim, the case is somewhat different. But your right, I can be an insensitive bastard at some times, I even been compared to a diplomat.

Read full topic

item.title: Kidnapping in Colorado
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

I honestly had no idea how widespread this story was, but yes please be sensitive because I would really love to strangle you or uppercut you right in the jaw right now if I met you face to face. Not that we’re looking for sympathy but I’ve never in my life seen a case such as this. I’m just curious if people have heard about the case, or have heard cases similar to this that may have been a large ordeal in your community but not talked on a national scale? Are you even from the US? I swore you were from Europe.

Read full topic

item.title: Kidnapping in Colorado
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

eyeownyew: I don’t think this thread have anything to do here because it is pretty common. There is over 10000 that get killed in US every year, we cannot focus on everything. We have to choose stuff that are special or keep it to a local level.

Read full topic

item.title: Kidnapping in Colorado
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Bowser jr:

Why should anyone outside Colorado care about this case?

You sound like Paul Ryan with his non-humanitarian ideals… Only you’re worse, because this case is a threat to national security

But seriously, fuck off, if you don’t care then why post? Why take a bigger toll on people’s emotions?

Read full topic

item.title: Kidnapping in Colorado
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Why should anyone outside Colorado care about this case?

item.title: Kidnapping in Colorado
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

I go to the school that Jessica’s cousins go to, and her elementary is less than 1000 feet from my house. Never knew you lived in Colorado too.

Anyway, it is very sad. Very, very sad. I’m very surprised it happened in such a great area too. I guess you aren’t safe anywhere these days.

Read full topic

item.title: Kidnapping in Colorado
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

latimes

Jessica Ridgeway case: FBI releases possible suspect profile

As officials investigate a body that could be that of 10-year-old Jessica Ridgeway, the focus of the missing-child case has shifted. Officials are now focused on the potential kidnapping element,...

The place the body was found (no announcement if it is Jessica yet) is down the street from my school I actually drove past the site where they found the remains today, and it was a bit spooky. Especially with having younger family members who attend school near where this all happened. With the fires we’ve had recently, the Aurora shooting, and now this there has been a huge emotional toll on everyone. Has anyone else seen or heard about this on the news? I’m not sure wide spread this story is with the media.
